label: cascading_failure_01_dx_storage_capacity_027
content:
## 2026-01-28 Daily Operations Summary

### Infrastructure
- stor-a-23
  - CPU Percentage: 97
  - Memory Percentage: 91
  - Disk Used Percentage: 99
  - Disk Busy Percentage: 99
  - Net In Gbps: 11.8
  - Net Out Gbps: 10.2
  - IO Wait Percentage: 19.0
- stor-b-22
  - CPU Percentage: 80
  - Memory Percentage: 82
  - Disk Used Percentage: 98
  - Disk Busy Percentage: 97
  - Net In Gbps: 8.9
  - Net Out Gbps: 8.1
  - IO Wait Percentage: 13.1
- stor-c-25
  - CPU Percentage: 71
  - Memory Percentage: 77
  - Disk Used Percentage: 97
  - Disk Busy Percentage: 92
  - Net In Gbps: 7.3
  - Net Out Gbps: 6.7
  - IO Wait Percentage: 9.4
- meta-02
  - CPU Percentage: 85
  - Memory Percentage: 96
  - Disk Used Percentage: 91
  - Disk Busy Percentage: 85
  - Net In Gbps: 5.0
  - Net Out Gbps: 4.2
  - IO Wait Percentage: 8.2

### Events
- Massive ingest (+246 TB) pushed utilization to 91.6% and triggered 8 quota hard blocks; executed emergency write restrictions for three non-essential namespaces.
- Compaction pending spiked to 152 with disk busy p95 96.2%; scheduled immediate compaction surge and reduced background scrub concurrency to avoid saturation.
- Scrub errors rose to 52; focused on the noisiest keyspaces and requested tenant-side delete batching to reduce tombstone fragmentation.
- Metadata cache hit dropped to 86.7% with manifest backlog 7.2k; paused all optional inventory jobs and increased metadata worker count by 1.

### On Call
- Shift: Ben K.
- Pages: 14
- Tickets: 24
- Status: Degraded; severe capacity pressure with quota blocks and compaction/scrub overload. Emergency write restrictions and metadata/job deferrals applied; compaction surge underway.
